News

Lowestoft Library registers youngest new borrower

Written by Hannah Foulstone · Published Aug 16, 2019

When new mum and schoolteacher Lucy Gildroy took her newborn daughter Summer into Lowestoft Library, she did so with one goal: to sign Summer up for her very first library card.

Suffolk's favourite children's book revealed!

Written by Hannah Foulstone · Published Aug 6, 2019

Suffolk Libraries has announced the top ten favourite children’s books in Suffolk, as voted for by the county’s library users.

Lesley’s Readers on BBC Radio Suffolk – book choice for September

Written by Alice Violett · Published Aug 6, 2019

This month Lesley will be discussing The Horseman, by Tim Pears.

New video streaming service available through Suffolk Libraries

Written by Hannah Foulstone · Published Aug 6, 2019

Suffolk Libraries has expanded its eLibrary service with a new digital streaming platform, Kanopy.

Keep fit and explore east Suffolk with the Three Library Challenge

Written by Hannah Foulstone · Published Aug 2, 2019

Three libraries are raising funds by challenging people to walk or cycle between their sites.

National Citizen Service volunteers challenge perceptions with Ipswich County Library placement

Written by Hannah Foulstone · Published Aug 2, 2019

This week, a group of twelve National Citizen Service volunteers assisted with services and activities at Ipswich County Library and learned about the many things the library offers.

Surge in attendance figures marks seven years of Suffolk Libraries

Written by Hannah Foulstone · Published Jul 30, 2019

This Thursday (1 August) marks seven years since Suffolk Libraries was launched as an independent and charitable organisation which now runs the county’s library service on behalf of Suffolk County Council.

Take part in OverDrive's Together We Read for August 2019

Written by Alice Violett · Published Jul 29, 2019

From 1 - 15 August, you can borrow The Binding by Bridget Collins on OverDrive without a wait list and join in a UK-wide discussion.

Making Life Better - read about our new strategy

Written by James Powell · Published Jul 16, 2019

Suffolk Libraries has a new strategy for the future.

Suffolk Libraries launches the first ever celebration of the county’s library service

Written by James Powell · Published Jul 11, 2019

Suffolk Libraries has officially launched a day of celebration to generate support for the county’s library service. The first ever Suffolk Libraries Day will take place on Saturday 12 October 2019
